Class Pet

java.lang.Object
group33.VirtualPet.src.main.model.Pet
public class Pet extends Object
Represents a virtual pet with customizable attributes and behaviors. Each pet has statistics (health, sleep, fullness, happiness) that change over time and can be affected by player actions. Pets can be of different types (DOG, DEER, etc.) with unique characteristics.
Since:
Winter 2025
Author:
Team 33 (Dhir, Kostya, Fatima, Anna)

    Enum representing different types of pets with their base statistics.

  • Constructor Details

    • Pet

      public Pet(String name, Pet.PetType type)
      Constructs a new Pet with the given name and type. Initializes all statistics based on the pet type's base values.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the pet
      type - The type of pet (from PetType enum)

  • Method Details

    • updateStatistics

      public void updateStatistics()
      Updates the pet's statistics based on time progression. Decreases sleep, fullness, and happiness according to their decline rates. Checks for critical states (sleep deprivation, hunger, etc.). Does nothing if the pet is dead or sleeping.

    • checkHealthState

      public void checkHealthState()
      Checks the pet's health state and updates death status.

    • feed

      public void feed(int foodValue)
      Feeds the pet, increasing its fullness. Has no effect if the pet is dead or sleeping.
      Parameters:
      foodValue - The amount to increase fullness by

    • giveGift

      public void giveGift(int giftValue)
      Gives a gift to the pet, increasing its happiness. Has no effect if the pet is dead or sleeping.
      Parameters:
      giftValue - The amount to increase happiness by

    • sleep

      public void sleep()
      Puts the pet to sleep. Has no effect if the pet is dead.

    • wakeUp

      public void wakeUp()
      Wakes the pet up and restores its sleep to maximum. Has no effect if the pet is dead.

    • exercise

      public void exercise()
      Exercises the pet, affecting multiple statistics. Reduces sleep and fullness while increasing health. Has no effect if the pet is dead or sleeping.

    • takeToVet

      public void takeToVet()
      Takes the pet to the vet, restoring some health. Has no effect if the pet is dead or sleeping.

    • isDead

      public boolean isDead()
      Checks if pet is dead
      Returns:
      Whether the pet is dead

    • isSleeping

      public boolean isSleeping()
      Checks if pet is sleeping
      Returns:
      Whether the pet is sleeping

      Checks if pet is hungry

      Whether the pet is hungry

    • isAngry

      public boolean isAngry()
      Checks if pet is angry
      Returns:
      Whether the pet is angry

      public int getHealth()
      Gets the health level
      Returns:
      The pet's current health

      Returns:
      The pet's name

      public Pet.PetType getType()
      Gets the pet type
      Returns:
      The pet's type

    • setHealth

      public void setHealth(int health)
      Sets the pet's health (clamped to 0-maxHealth)
      Parameters:
      health - The new health value

    • setDead

      public void setDead(boolean dead)
      Sets the pet's dead flag
      Parameters:
      dead - , true or false

    • setHappiness

      public void setHappiness(int happiness)
      Sets the pet's happiness (clamped to 0-maxHappiness)
      Parameters:
      happiness - The new happiness value

    • setFullness

      public void setFullness(int fullness)
      Sets the pet's fullness (clamped to 0-maxFullness)
      Parameters:
      fullness - The new fullness value

    • setSleep

      public void setSleep(int sleep)
      Sets the pet's sleep level (clamped to 0-maxSleepiness)
      Parameters:
      sleep - The new sleep value

    • revive

      public void revive()
      Revives a dead pet and restores all statistics to maximum. Resets all negative states (dead, sleeping, hungry, angry).
